title: Validator Client `--help` description is sometimes inconsistent
body:
### Describe the bug

Some help flags begin with a capital letter, some not.
Exemple:

```
   db                           defines commands for interacting with the Prysm validator database
   web                          defines commands for interacting with the Prysm web interface
   help, h                      Shows a list of commands or help for one command
```

Some help flags start with a verb ending with `s`, some not.
Exemple:

```
 --api-timeout value            Specifies the timeout value for API requests in seconds (default: 120)
 --clear-db                     Prompt for clearing any previously stored data at the data directory (default: false)
```

Some help flags end with a period, some not.
Exemple:

```
  --enable-tracing               Enable request tracing. (default: false)
  --force-clear-db               Clear any previously stored data at the data directory (default: false)
```

Sometimes, the default value is printed 2 times.
Exemple:

```
  --grpc-max-msg-size value      Integer to define max receive message call size. If serving a public gRPC server, set this to a more reasonable size to avoid resource exhaustion from large messages. Validators with as many as 10000 keys can be run with a max message size of less than 50Mb. The default here is set to a very high value for local users. (default: 2147483647 (2Gi)). (default: 2147483647)
```

Long line are not wrapped by the CLI manager, so the help is sometimes complex to read.
Exemple:

![image](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/assets/4943830/d64a5d67-70c8-4ea3-a346-518f3cb53b60)

The `AUTHOR` section is empty:
```
NAME:
   validator - launches an Ethereum validator client that interacts with a beacon chain, starts proposer and attester services, p2p connections, and more
USAGE:
   validator [options] command [command options] [arguments...]
   
AUTHOR:
   
   
GLOBAL OPTIONS:
   wallet                       defines commands for interacting with Ethereum validator wallets
```


In `OPTIONS`, only `GLOBAL` is capitalised.
Example:

```
GLOBAL OPTIONS:
   wallet                       defines commands for interacting with Ethereum validator wallets
   accounts                     defines commands for interacting with Ethereum validator accounts
   ...

cmd OPTIONS:
  --accept-terms-of-use          Accept Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments) (default: false)
  --api-timeout value            Specifies the timeout value for API requests in seconds (default: 120)
  ...

debug OPTIONS:
  --blockprofilerate value      Turn on block profiling with the given rate (default: 0)
  --cpuprofile value            Write CPU profile to the given file
  --memprofilerate value        Turn on memory profiling with the given rate (default: 524288)
  ...
```
